poem:
The Announcement

Bathers freeze mid-dip,   
as a lifeguard's voice crackles   
through salty air—  
"Attention all bathers," he calls,    
each word a pebble skipping across,   
waves of cheers ripple   
under the Tel Aviv sun,   
a chorus of claps   
while seagulls circle,   
oblivious to human matters,   
gliding merely in search   
of their next piece of bread.
